meanings.sent1: The new word was pronounceable and easy to say.
meanings.sent2: She found the foreign name surprisingly pronounceable.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to say the tongue-twister, but it sounded like gibberish - definitely not pronounceable!
meanings.sent4: The ancient language was so complex that its words were barely pronounceable by modern speakers.
meanings.sent5: Her name was so long and unpronounceable that she decided to go by a nickname instead.

meanings.definition: Able to be spoken or articulated clearly.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's instructions were always clear and pronounceable.
meanings.sent2: The singer had a beautiful, pronounceable voice that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to mimic the words, but they came out in a barely pronounceable jumble.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were so intense that his words became barely pronounceable through tears.
meanings.sent5: The recipe was written in such a way that even a beginner cook could follow the pronounceable steps.
